site_name: Site Of Former Northoit Grange Community Centre And Part Of St Raphael's Catholic School
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings and supporting documents:

NHG_HGP_ZZ_05_DR_A_0100 P01 (Site Location Plan); NHG_HGP_ZZ_05_DR_A_0101 P01 (Existing Site Plan); NHG_HGP_ZZ_05_DR_A_0102 P01 (Proposed Site Plan); NHG_HGP_ZZ_XX_DR_A_0103 Rev P01 (Existing and Proposed Street Elevation); NHG_HGP_ZZ_05_DR_A_0104 P01 (Proposed Substation Plan and Elevations); Northolt Grange Ealing Ecological Assessment (ref. 9272.002), dated February 2022; Noise Assessment (ref. LR01-22301-R0), dated 27 October 2023.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall be in accordance with those described in the hereby approved drawings listed in Condition 2.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), Policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), Policy DAA of Ealing's draft new Local Plan (Regulation 18) and the NPPF (2023).

| The individual and combined external sound level emitted from plant, machinery or equipment at the revised electric substation location shall not exceed a noise rating level of 32 dB(A) at the nearest and most affected noise sensitive premises at the development site and at surrounding premises, including external amenity space, as predicted by  Cass Allen in their report ref.LR01-22301-R0 dated 27 October 2023. The assessment shall be made in accordance with BS4142:2014 +A1 2019, with all machinery operating together at maximum capacity.

Reason:  To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with Policy D14 of the London Plan (2021), Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Policy DAA of Ealing's draft new Local Plan (Regulation 18).

| Prior to use, machinery, plant and equipment/ extraction/ ventilation system and ducting at the development shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such.

Reason:  To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by vibration noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with Policy D14 of the London Plan (2021), Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Policy DAA of Ealing's draft new Local Plan (Regulation 18).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the recommendations set in the Northolt Grange Ealing Ecological Assessment (ref. 9272.002) dated February 2022 unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
Reason: To mitigate the potential harm to ecology and improve biodiversity in accordance with G6 of the London Plan (2021).
description: Construction of an electrical substation with associated timber fence and gate (Regulation 3 Application by London Borough of Ealing)
